dublin_core.dcvalue: An Ontology Of Patient Safety OOPS II for handheld interfaces was developed from a 6 axis primary care taxonomy of errors Using a hand held Electronic Student Encounter Log ESEL 3rd year medical students were asked to record data from 3 written scenarios involving medical errors Students were encouraged to use a series of drop down menus to record error types Students could augment their selections with free text Although some variation existed students answers were much more consistent than in our previous interfaces
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T15:54:12Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2006-06-16
AMIA ... Annual Symposium proceedings / AMIA Symposium. AMIA Symposium
OOPS: test of a structure for recording patient safety events.
